custom_fields.key_topics: Basics of cryptography; distributed systems; finance and trading; networking; financial regulation.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: 15-122 or equivalent recommended but not mandatory.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: The project will be essentially a retooled version of the first homework used in 17-303, and will consist of approximately four problems.
custom_fields.goals: This course primarily aims at providing a thorough understanding of modern cryptocurrencies, ranging from their cryptographic underpinnings, to their applications both licit and illicit, to the nascent legislation governing them. As a byproduct of the course, students will learn a number of elementary cryptographic constructions, which will help them build a sound foundational basis for more advanced courses in cryptography and computer security. By the end of the 9unit variant of the course, students are able to reason about cryptocurrencies, both from a technological perspective, and from a legal and regulatory perspective. They know the most important recent developments in cryptocurrencies and blockchains, and can describe them and determine whether these technologies are applicable to certain industry sectors. This proposed microcourse roughly corresponds to the first third of the 17303 course taught in Pittsburgh it provides the basics and will be selfcontained. It could potentially be followed by an elementary microcourse primarily covering scripting and novel consensus mechanisms, and potentially by an advanced microcourse covering advanced topics such as anonymous cryptocurrencies, deanonymization, and so forth.
custom_fields.relevance: This course is of interest to both computer science students with an interest in cryptocurrencies, and who want to learn more about the financial and public policy implications, and to finance students who have an interest in understanding technical underpinnings of cryptocurrencies and blockchains
custom_fields.learning_resources: We will work with both the Bitcoin textbook and the Handbook of Applied Cryptography, both of which are freely available online. We may also resort to Mastering Bitcoin, also available for free online.

long_desc: Cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin have gained large popularity in recent years, in no small part due to the fantastic potential applications they could facilitate. This course will provide an overview of the technological mechanisms behind cryptocurrencies and distributed consensus and distributed ledgers blockchains, introducing along the way the necessary cryptographic tools publicprivate key cryptography, signatures, etc.
name: Basics of Cryptocurrencies, Blockchains, and Applications
base_name: Basics of Cryptocurrencies, Blockchains, and Applications
